English: to be disinterested, to be bored, to be tired of, to be weary (akiru)

French: あした、あす、みょうにち、明日

English: I, myself (atashi, mainly used by females [softer sounding])
that direction, thing, person, or place over there (achira, acchi)

French: いっしゅうかん、一週間
いとこ、従兄弟、従姉妹、従兄、従弟、従姉、従妹

English: volitional ending [う for u-verbs, よう for ru-verbs]: "Let's…" or "I will" (u, yō)
to be filled, to be surrounded, to overflow (umaru)
to be buried, to be covered (umoreru)

French: えんぴつけずり、鉛筆削り

English: to be astonished, to be surprised, to be scared (odoroku)
I, myself (ore, mainly used by males [informal])
to exchange, to substitute, to replace (kaeru)
to harden, to solidify, to become firm (katamaru)

French: かなしむ、悲しむ、哀しむ
くうこう、空港 （ひこうじょう、飛行場）
くるま、車 (じどうしゃ、自動車)

English: this direction, thing, person, or place (kochira, kocchi)
to raise or extend one's hands (sasu)
bill [of money, e.g., a thousand-yen bill] (satsu)

French: さびしい、寂しい、淋しい
さみしい、寂しい、淋しい

English: to wake, to become sober, to be disillusioned (sameru)

French: しかい、歯科医、はいしゃ、歯医者
じどうはんばいき、自動販売機
すばらしい、素晴らしい
すぺいんご、スペイン語

English: causative ending [せる for u-verbs, させる for ru-verbs]: to make [someone do something], to allow (seru, saseru)

French: センチメートル、センチ

English: indicates that it seems the verb occurs [e.g., "It seems he ate"] (sōda)
that direction, thing, person, or place (sochira, socchi)
things like <list of things>, including, such things as (dano)
indicates that it seems the verb occurs; also used to ask whether the verb occurs (darō)

French: チャック、ファスナー、ジッパー
ちょうせんご、朝鮮語、かんこくご、韓国語

English: particle indicating that the speaker is trying to recall some information ["What class is next -kke?"] (-kke)
casual topic marker (ttara) [colloquial form of to ittara (if you refer to ~; as for ~)
ongoing occurrence (tsutsu) [similar to ながら but has different tone, and both actions have equal weight]

French: つりせん、釣り銭、おつり、お釣り

English: te form of verb or adjective [see explanation]
(particle used to indicate that what precedes it is an extreme example and strongly negates it) (dokoro)
which direction, thing, person, or place (dochira, docchi)
the copula particle used after quasi-adjectives (na)
informal negative (nai, n) [ん is a slurred version and sounds a little masculine]
to console, to consolate, to provide empathy (nagusameru)

French: にほんご、日本語 （こくご、国語）

English: archaic informal negative ["he hath", "thou didst", etc.] (nu)
emphasis and question marker, equivalent to "right?" (ne)
topic marker (wa) [although ha is the hiragana used, wa is the pronunciation)

French: はいいろ、灰色、ねずみいろ、鼠色
バナナ、かんしょう、甘蕉

English: width, breadth, free room, difference (between two substances) (haba)
to grow cold, to get chilly, to cool down (hieru)

French: ふらんすご、フランス語

English: to (e) [Note: へ is normally read he, but when used as this particle its reading changes to e]
I, myself (boku, mainly used by males)
to be disturbed, to become confused (midareru)
to rest, to take a break, to go to bed (yasumu)
to celebrate, to be jubilant, to have joy, to have delight, to have rapture (yorokobu)
passive verb ending [れる for u-verbs, られる for ru-verbs]: to be <verbed> [e.g., 食べられる, "to be eaten"] (reru, rareru)
to split intoin, to be divided (wakareru)
to partin, to separatein, to break upin (wakareru)
